about.description:
XGBoost is an optimized distributed gradient boosting library designed to be highly efficient,
flexible and portable. It implements machine learning algorithms under the Gradient Boosting
framework. XGBoost provides a parallel tree boosting (also known as GBDT, GBM) that solve many
data science problems in a fast and accurate way. The same code runs on major distributed
environment (Hadoop, SGE, MPI) and can solve problems beyond billions of examples.
about.summary:
Scalable, Portable and Distributed Gradient Boosting (GBDT, GBRT or GBM) Library, for
Python, R, Java, Scala, C++ and more. Runs on single machine, Hadoop, Spark, Flink
and DataFlow

name: py-xgboost
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.18.9
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
    name: py-xgboost
    version: '0.90'
source:
    git_rev: 515f5f5c4779ff5361dcd796e22d55937e1048ea
    git_url: https://github.com/dmlc/xgboost
    patches:
        - 0001-conda-Unbundle-libxgboost.-dll-dylib-so.patch
        - 0002-Fix-R-package-PKGROOT.patch
        - 0003-Fix-R-package-mingw-w64-compiler-flags-remove-m64.patch
build:
    noarch: false
    number: '2'
    script: install-py-xgboost.sh
    string: py36he1b5a44_2
requirements:
    build:
        - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 main
        - binutils_impl_linux-64 2.31.1 h6176602_1
        - binutils_linux-64 2.31.1 h6176602_8
        - gcc_impl_linux-64 7.3.0 habb00fd_1
        - gcc_linux-64 7.3.0 h553295d_8
        - gxx_impl_linux-64 7.3.0 hdf63c60_1
        - gxx_linux-64 7.3.0 h553295d_8
        - libgcc-ng 9.1.0 hdf63c60_0
        - libstdcxx-ng 9.1.0 hdf63c60_0
    host:
        - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 main
        - ca-certificates 2019.6.16 hecc5488_0
        - certifi 2019.6.16 py36_1
        - libffi 3.2.1 he1b5a44_1006
        - libgcc-ng 9.1.0 hdf63c60_0
        - libstdcxx-ng 9.1.0 hdf63c60_0
        - libxgboost 0.90 he1b5a44_2
        - ncurses 6.1 hf484d3e_1002
        - openssl 1.1.1c h516909a_0
        - pip 19.2.2 py36_0
        - python 3.6.7 h357f687_1005
        - readline 8.0 hf8c457e_0
        - setuptools 41.0.1 py36_0
        - sqlite 3.29.0 hcee41ef_0
        - tk 8.6.9 hed695b0_1002
        - wheel 0.33.6 py36_0
        - xz 5.2.4 h14c3975_1001
        - zlib 1.2.11 h516909a_1005
    run:
        - _py-xgboost-mutex 2.0 cpu_0
        - libgcc-ng >=7.3.0
        - libstdcxx-ng >=7.3.0
        - libxgboost 0.90 he1b5a44_2
        - numpy
        - python >=3.6,<3.7.0a0
        - scikit-learn
        - scipy
test:
    imports:
        - xgboost
    script: test-py-xgboost.py
about:
    description: 'XGBoost is an optimized distributed gradient boosting library designed
        to be highly efficient,

        flexible and portable. It implements machine learning algorithms under the
        Gradient Boosting

        framework. XGBoost provides a parallel tree boosting (also known as GBDT,
        GBM) that solve many

        data science problems in a fast and accurate way. The same code runs on major
        distributed

        environment (Hadoop, SGE, MPI) and can solve problems beyond billions of examples.

        '
    dev_url: https://github.com/dmlc/xgboost/
    doc_url: https://xgboost.readthedocs.io/
    home: https://github.com/dmlc/xgboost
    license: Apache-2.0
    license_file: LICENSE
    summary: 'Scalable, Portable and Distributed Gradient Boosting (GBDT, GBRT or
        GBM) Library, for

        Python, R, Java, Scala, C++ and more. Runs on single machine, Hadoop, Spark,
        Flink

        and DataFlow

        '
extra:
    copy_test_source_files: true
    final: true
    recipe-maintainers:
        - aldanor
        - beckermr
